conflictDescription: Some lowest-level NFRs conflict because US-151 expects ALFRED to provide support and suggestions proactively to empower the user, which can imply system-initiated interactions, whereas US-058 requires ALFRED to activate only upon explicit user request and limit notifications to an absolute minimum to avoid pressure. These goals partially contradict in terms of system proactivity and user control.
conflictingNfrPairs: Provide support and suggestions that empower the user
ALFRED activates only upon explicit user request.
Provide support and suggestions that empower the user
Notifications and reminders are limited to an absolute minimum.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult with mild mobility issues, I want ALFRED to offer support and suggestions that empower me and align with my desire for some control, even if that means the system may occasionally feel controlling, so I can improve my health and daily life while maintaining my independence.
userStoryBSummary: As a retired social worker who is cautious about technology and privacy, I want ALFRED to activate only when I explicitly ask and to limit notifications and reminders to an absolute minimum, so I maintain full control and avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by the system.
